context_meta.summary: LeBron James should not even be considered in the discussion for this season's MVP, according to American sports analyst Chris Broussard, who claims James Harden is the clear runaway leader to win the end of season honour. The 33-year-old is breaking records seemingly on a weekly basis and against the Toronto Raptors he became the first player in NBA history to register at least 35 points and 17 assists with zero turnovers. Yet the Cleveland Cavaliers' struggles in the Eastern Conference as opposed to the dominance shown by the Houston Rockets in a tough Western Conference could prove to be his downfall. context_meta.title: Daily Grains Analysis for March 27, 2018
context_meta.summary: Dry weather in Argentina is supporting corn and soybean prices, with only a few showers over the weekend and little rain expected next week. Corn prices are down on Tuesday following whipsaw price action on Monday which saw corn attempt to move higher and then settle on its lows. Momentum is negative as the MACD histogram is printing in the red with a downward sloping trajectory which points to lower prices.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: LiAngelo Ball scores 72 points on day he declared
context_meta.summary: LaVar Ball's middle son, LiAngelo Ball, declared for the NBA draft on Tuesday just hours before putting up a monster stat line in Lithuania. In a Big Baller Brand Challenge game between Vytautas and the Guangdong Southern Tigers youth team, the former UCLA freshman scored 72 points with 11 rebounds in the 159-115 win. His younger brother, LaMelo, added 36 points while LaVar served as head coach. Even though the 72 points was a massive number, it's important to note the competition. It was a youth team from China while Vytautas generally played its full LKL squad. The game was considered "worthless" by a journalist covering the team. With the 72 points, LiAngelo matched his career-high effort

context_meta.title: OKC Thunder's Carmelo Anthony Problem Is More Perception Than Reality
context_meta.summary: The Carmelo Anthony situation is starting to feel like a situation. And if you don't know the difference, the latter is what happens when, already mired in what many would term a disappointing year, a theoretical star shoots 3-of-13 from the field in a pivotal late-season loss to a conference rival...with playoff position at stake. That's what happened when Melo went cold down the stretch against the Portland Trail Blazers on Sunday. He clanked threes late in the game (including one at the buzzer that could have tied it), turned it over on OKC's second-to-last possession and generally fed the already engorged narrative that he's been a bad fit and a massive failure whose role must be minimized

context_meta.title: Celtics Notes: Jayson Tatum-Josh Jackson Duel; Update On Marcus Morris' Injury
context_meta.summary: Jayson Tatum and Josh Jackson have been compared to each other for years. They are the same age and play the same position. Both were five-star recruits coming out of high school who went to blue-blood programs. They played on the USA under-19, under-17 and under-16 teams together. Both elected to enter the 2017 NBA Draft after their freshman season, and their games were measured against one another in the runup to the draft. Tatum went No. 3 overall to the Boston Celtics. Jackson No. 4 to the Phoenix Suns. It's an underrated rivalry that surely will grow as both players NBA careers progress, especially with the Celtics electing to draft Tatum over Jackson after the Kansas product canceled a

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: John Calipari: 'Just about every' Kentucky basketball player will put name in NBA draft
context_meta.summary: LEXINGTON, Ky. – Kentucky basketball fans will have to wait a little longer to find out which players are leaving for the NBA draft. UK coach John Calipari plans to meet with players about their futures before he leaves for the Final Four Thursday but had not yet begun those conversations as of his weekly radio show Monday night. Even after players declare for the draft, it could be weeks though before we know exactly what the 2018-19 roster will look like. “My expectation would be that just about every one of them will but their name in the draft to figure out…where that committee sees them going,” Calipari said, citing the NCAA's recent rule change that allows players to workout with teams

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Rockets set record, put celebration on hold
context_meta.summary: James Harden scored 27 points as the red-hot Houston Rockets won their franchise record 59th game with a 114-91 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans on Saturday. Harden, who only played three quarters, shot 11-of-24 from the field and nailed a couple of long-range three pointers for the Rockets who won their eighth consecutive game. The NBA-leading Rockets improved to 59-14 to overtake the 1993-94 championship team for the most wins in franchise history. Coach Mike D'Antoni said he was happy for his players but said they didn't feel like celebrating this milestone. "I just told them. They didn't care," he said. "I'm kind of happy. I thought it was nice. They absolutely did not care. "They will
